column4: guys why 12.10 doesn't appear in my update manager? i've been waiting, but wikipedia says it was released on 10/18. what should i do?
Open Software Sources. On the "Updates" tab, change the notify me of new versions from LTS to "any" and it will prompt you after reloading.
The default is Long Term Services only because typically the intermediates are "beta" versions. (I use that term VERY loosely).
loadid, wilee-nilee got it! thank friends.
make sure you read the release notes first.
because if you're using an older ATI card, you might run into issues.
oh no, i am using an ATI indeed.
it's in my laptop i use for everything, watch movies connected to my tv.
friend, i have an older desktop with ubuntu too. what thing didn't work in your desktop?
now i am getting scared... but i'll update anyway both machines XD
Do the laptop first (back it up before you start though). If it works, then do the desktop.  Don't do them at the same time.
yeah i won't, i'll need the interwebs to search for help just in case...
I can't emphasize the backup first part enough though. If it doesn't work, you may have to reinstall 12.04 (or whatever version you're on now).
thanks friend for all your advices, you are so nice :)
